intro: Alyxia semipallescens, commonly known as the Florida alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, and it thrives in sandy or disturbed soils. Alyxia semipallescens is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to humid, subtropical climates.
